# **MurTree Resources**

These additional resources encompass supplementary materials detailing the evolution and architecture of MurTree. They feature additional references to preceding algorithms that contributed to its development, along with the foundational paper upon which this website is structured.

### **Foundational Paper and Githhub**

1.Demirović, E., Lukina, A. S., Hebrard, E., Chan, J., Bailey, J., Leckie, C., Ramamohanarao, K., Stuckey, P. J., & De Raedt, L.. (n.d.). MurTree: Optimal Decision Trees via Dynamic Programming and Search. 23.

2.MurTree/murtree. (n.d.). MurTree/murtree. Retrieved May 7, 2024, from <https://github.com/MurTree/murtree>

### **Previous work contributing to Design of MurTree**

1.  Binarising

    1.  Siegfried Nijssen and Elisa Fromont. Optimal constraint-based
        decision tree induction from itemset lattices. Data Mining and
        Knowledge Discovery, 21(1), 2010

    2.  Nina Narodytska, Alexey Ignatiev, Filipe Pereira, and Joao
        Marques-Silva. Learning optimal decision trees with SAT. In
        Proceedings of IJCAI, 2018

    3.  Sicco Verwer and Yingqian Zhang. Learning optimal classification
        trees using a binary linear program formulation. In Proceedings
        of AAAI, 2019.

    4.  Dimitris Bertsimas and Jack Dunn. Optimal classification trees.
        Machine Learning, 106(7),2017.

2.  Lower Bounding

    1.  Elaine Angelino, Nicholas Larus-Stone, Daniel Alabi, Margo
        Seltzer, and Cynthia Rudin. Learning certifiably optimal rule
        lists for categorical data. The Journal of Machine Learning
        Research, 2017.

    2.  Mohammed J Zaki and Karam Gouda. Fast vertical mining using
        diffsets. In Proceedings of SIGKDD, 2003.

3.  Misclassification

    1.  Hélene Verhaeghe, Siegfried Nijssen, Gilles Pesant, Claude-Guy
        Quimper, and Pierre Schaus.Learning optimal decision trees using
        constraint programming. In Proceedings of CP, 2019.

    2.  Hao Hu, Mohamed Siala, Emmanuel Hebrard, and Marie-José Huguet.
        Learning optimal decision trees with maxsat and its integration
        in adaboost. In Proceedings of IJCAI, 2020.

4.  Frequency Counting for Mining

```         
1.   Mohammed Javeed Zaki. Scalable algorithms for association
    mining. IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering,
    12(3), 2000.

2.   Albrecht Zimmermann and Luc De Raedt. Cluster-grouping: from
    subgroup discovery to clustering. Machine Learning, 77(1), 2009.
```

5.  Dynamic Programming and Search

    1.  Siegfried Nijssen and Elisa Fromont. Optimal constraint-based
        decision tree induction from itemset lattices. Data Mining and
        Knowledge Discovery, 21(1), 2010

    2.  Hélene Verhaeghe, Siegfried Nijssen, Gilles Pesant, Claude-Guy
        Quimper, and Pierre Schaus.Learning optimal decision trees using
        constraint programming. In Proceedings of CP, 2019.

    3.  Thibaut Vidal and Maximilian Schiffer. Born-again tree
        ensembles. In Proceedings of ICML,2020.

6.  Constraints and Caching

    1.  Gaël Aglin, Siegfried Nijssen, and Pierre Schaus. Learning
        optimal decision trees using caching branch-and-bound search. In
        Proceedings of AAAI, 2020a.

    2.  Jimmy Lin, Chudi Zhong, Diane Hu, Cynthia Rudin, and Margo
        Seltzer. Generalized and scalable optimal sparse decision trees.
        In Proceedings of ICML, 2020.

    3.  Sicco Verwer and Yingqian Zhang. Learning decision trees with
        flexible constraints and objectives using integer optimization.
        In Proceedings of CPAIOR, 2017.

    4.  Florent Avellaneda. Efficient inference of optimal decision
        trees. In Proceedings of AAAI,2020

    5.  Xiyang Hu, Cynthia Rudin, and Margo Seltzer. Optimal sparse
        decision trees. In Proceedings of NeurIPS, 2019.

7.  Nonlinear Metrics and Sparse

    1.  Emir Demirović and Peter Stuckey. Optimal decision trees for
        nonlinear metrics. In Proceedings of AAAI, 2021.

    2.  Rafael Blanquero, Emilio Carrizosa, Cristina Molero-Río, and
        Dolores Romero Morales. Sparsity in optimal randomized
        classification trees. European Journal of Operational Research,

        2020.
